turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about American Government (textbook).
turn.2: American Government (textbook) American Government is a textbook, now in its sixteenth edition, by the noted public administration scholar James Q. Wilson and political scientist John J. DiIulio, Jr.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: DiIulio is a Democrat who served as the director of the White House Office of Faith-Based and Community Initiatives under president George W. Bush in 2001. Wilson, a Republican, has chaired and participated in numerous White House task forces and commissions, and was awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom by president George W. Bush in 2003.
turn.8: The book examines and analyzes the government of the United States, covering every aspect of government from elections to interest groups.
turn.9: How many editions of the textbook are there?
turn.10: The current edition, "American Government: Institutions and Policies" also lists co-authors Meena Bose and Matthew Levendusky.
turn.12: It is published by Cengage Learning.
